intro: Physeterostemon thomasii, commonly known as the Thomas's physeterostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves, typical of the mint family. Its small, tubular flowers are usually arranged in clusters and bloom in shades of purple or pink. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
